title: Cedar Breaks National Monument: Basic Information
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information             Basic Information           Fees & Passes     Entrance Fees:   16 + Years Old - $5.00 This fee is for visitors, age 16 or older and is valid for 7 days from the time of purchase.    Age 0-15 Free! - $0.00 There is no fee for children 15 years old or younger.    Entrance Passes:   Cedar Breaks Annual Pass - $20.00 Admission to Cedar Breaks National Monument for one year from date of purchase. This pass covers the entrance fee for the purchaser and three additional people 16 years of age or older. Admission for children 15 & under is free.                 More Information to Help Plan Your Trip...          More Information About Fees and Passes Learn your options when paying park entrance fees.         More Information About Operating Hours & Seasons The park is open year-round, but facilities and services vary with the season. Find out what is available for your trip and when campgrounds and the visitor center will be open.         Current Conditions Get information on the weather, road conditions and what is currently available in the park.            Camping Get details on our campground facilities, reservations, when the campground opens and closes, and more.         Reservations & Special Permits Find information about camping reservations and special use permits for commercial and non-commercial events, such as races, weddings, commercial filming and more.         Cell & WiFi Part of the charm of visiting Cedar Breaks is getting away from it all. Cell and WiFi service are extremely limited so get ready to be out of touch.        NPS Photo by Greta Rybus  Pets Find out the rules and recommendations for keeping pets and wildlife safe in Cedar Breaks National Monument.
